intro: Marcgravia trianae, commonly known as the Trianas's climbing plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Gesneriaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on trees or rocks in the understory of rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
